cli-parm.name: createziprelease
cli-parm.tip: Yes if the released application should be zipped for distribution

cli-parm.name: zipfile
cli-parm.tip: Path to the output zip folder holding the complete release

cli-parm.name: releasename
cli-parm.tip: Name of the release. May hold placeholders. Will be used as the file name of the ZIP result.
cli-parm.desc:
This is a description string holding any combination of the following placeholders: [project-name] which represents the -project parameter [application-name] which represents the -application parameter [version] which represents the version as specified in the UML [phase] which represents the phase as specified in the UML [release] which represents the release as specified in the UML [documentation-release] which represents the -docrelease parameter [generation-id] which represents a unique generation ID based in the date and time
For example: -zipfilename release-[project-name]-[application-name]-[version]-[phase]-[release][documentation-release]-[generation-id] May result in: "release-MyProject-MyApplication-MyVersion-2-20160301-at-20160323-102945.zip"
